channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2023110083
item.description:
Report E-2023110083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 25, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1866 were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer floor, tires, and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected two (2) damaged 5-gallon pails of UN1866 for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor and pavement beneath trailer and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Once collected, TLE personnel utilized a degreasing agent with absorbent pads to collect any residual product on trailer floor, trailer tires and pavement. All undamaged freight was re-stacked and secured for normal transport. All UN1866 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum and two (2) 35-gallon drums and RLC personnel took possession of the waste.

item.title: Report E-2023110081
item.description:
Report E-2023110081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 25, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1213 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the isobutyl acetate-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100920
item.description:
Report E-2023100920

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-02
  • City: HARRISON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CONSIGNEE EMPLOYEE OPENED CTMV DOME COVER TO PREPARE UNLOADING. DRIVER INSTRUCTED BY UNLOADER TO REPOSITION UNIT. CONSIGNEE EMPLOYEE FAILED TO RECLOSE AND SECURE DOME COVER. AFTER REPOSITING COMPLETED UNLOADER DISCOVER PRODUCT HAD BEEN RELEASED ONTO TOP OF TANK DURING MOVEMENT. RELEASE CLEANED UP BY PLANT PERSONNEL AND UNLOADING COMPLETED WITHOUT ADDITIONAL INCIDENT.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was discovered wet and upon inspection, a few of the press and twist caps were loose allowing liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened to stop further leaking

item.title: Report X-2023082008
item.description:
Report X-2023082008

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: Middleburg Heights
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release during sort operations at the CLER location. The fiberboard box contained four plastic buckets of a substance identified as a UN3082. The lid on one of the four buckets came loose and released its contents inside of the box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package. The fiberboard box didn't have any hazardous material markings or paperwork attached. This was a multi piece shipment and all three packages are being held for FAA inspection.
